teaser: Shake the beliefs those you find lacking
spellText: You speak out against a target within range, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, before the spell ends, the target rolls a d4 and subtracts the number rolled to the next ability check. It can roll the die before or after making the ability check. The spell then ends. On a successful saving throw the target knows you tried to sway their beliefs.

teaser: Guide the aim of the blessed
spellText: You touch one willing creature. That creature can add a +1 to their next attack roll.  It can roll the die before or after making the ability check. then the spell ends. This spell, can be cast on one creature at a time, if cast again the spell on the first target dissipates. At level 5 this increases to +2, at level 11 it becomes +3.

You unleash a flurry of lies laced with harmful enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 psychic damage. This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

teaser: Hamper vision to get the upper hand
spellText: You attempt to disorientate a creature you can touch. The creature makes a DEX save against your spell save DC. On a failure, you have advantage on your next attack on the target and the target has disadvantage on their next attack against you, until the start of their next turn.

teaser: Try not to get hit, if you do then it's okay
spellText: Reduce the next incoming attack roll by -1. If the attack still lands, you can reduce the damage 1d4.

teaser: Try not to get hit, if you do then it's okay
spellText:
You supercharge your unarmed weapons and make an attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects plus an additional 1d8 magic damage.

At Higher Levels. At 5th level, the unarmed attack deals an extra 1d8 magic damage to the target on a hit (Total 2d8). Damage rolls increase by 1d8 at 11th level (3d8) and 17th level (4d8).

teaser: Give your opponents the worst hayfever
spellText: You cause all the flowers around you to pollinate and blow out a cloud of pollen. Any creature within 60ft of you makes a CON save against you spell save. On a failure they have disadvantage on CON saves and movement speed is reduced by 10ft. On a success they can't be effected by this for 1 minute.

teaser: Make them think twice before slinging spells at you
spellText: You can cast this as a reaction to block a cantrip cast at you. This has a chance to reflect the spell cast back at the caster. Both you and the caster roll 1d20 + your spell casting ability modifier. Who ever rolls lower takes the damage the caster rolled then doubles it.

You summon a pair of backup vocalists to assist yourself or a creature you touch. While the spell is in effect, you gain a +2 to your next performance ability check. Alternatively if the target makes casts a spell that does damage, the spell add 1d4 psychic damage. After one of the spells functions is achieved the spell dissipates.

This spell's damage increases by 2d4 when you reach 5th level (3d4), 11th level (5d4), and 17th level (7d4).

You rid a 20ft radius of harmful pests to crops. Beasts take 1d8 poison damage then make a DC 10 Con save or are feared for 1 round and run away from the caster. Once effected by the fear it can not happen again for 1 hour.

Target a holy symbol within 60ft of you that is no larger than 1ft by 1ft. You can make it glow with the light of its represented deity. The symbol provides light in a 15ft radius. If the holy symbol is not being held by anyone then it slowly burns a holy fire around it. If the holy symbol is being held by a target that is friendly then they can add 1d6 radiant damage to their next attack roll. If the holy symbol is being held by a hostile target then they take 1d6 radiant damage. Once the radiant damage is dealt, the holy fire is consumed and the light fades as the spell ends.

This spell's damage increases by 2d6 when you reach 5th level (3d6), 11th level (5d6), and 17th level (7d6).

You amplify the sounds of nature around you, friendly creatures within 30ft gain advantage of saving throws against being frightened. A hostile target you can see and can hear takes 1d6 psychic damage.

This spells damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

teaser: Take the Hit to Make the Play
spellText:
When you take damage from non-magical attacks, you gains resistance on the same type of damage. At the end of your next turn you lose the resistance and take 1d6 damage, which can't be reduced in any way.

This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

teaser: You learn a lot about someone when you share a meal together.
spellText: Living off the land has given you a keen understanding of food. You can double a ration or serving of food to allow a second person to be satisfised. When you share a meal together you both get 1d6 + caster level temp hitpoints until you eat again.

As a reaction to taking a condition from the below list, you can make a Con save against a DC of 15 or the original save, whichever is higher, on a success, roll a 1d4 and you halt the effects of that condition by for rounds equal to the 1d4 rolled. If the origin of the condition is a spell over 5th level, you are unable to stave off the condition.

Valid Conditions:
  • Blinded
  • Deafened
  • Incapacitated
  • Paralysed
  • Petrified
  • Poisoned
  • Stunned
  • Unconscious
  • Invisible
higher_level: When cast at higher levels of 5th level or above, you can stave off conditions from spells of up to that level.

teaser: This is that new sound you were looking for
spellText: You summon a group of either: fey, celestial, fiendish or spiritual creatures. They present themselves as either a small band of musicians, choir or acapella group. of They provide backing music to your feats and actions and can not be targeted or damaged. They grant others within 30ft a bonus equal to your Charisma Bonus to Ability Checks and Saving throws.

You summon a musical band of either: fey, celestial, fiendish or spiritual creatures. Pick a point and band will produce painful music within a sphere with 15ft radius of the point. Each creature must make a WIS saving throw against your spell save DC, on a failure the creature takes 1d12 thunder damage, and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to deal 1d12 thunder damage to any creature within the sphere, if it is their first time in the spell's area of affect, they must make a WIS saving throw, if this is not the first time, they take the damage automatically . The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else. The spell also ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you.
Reduce the attack roll of an incoming attack roll by -1. If the attack still lands, you heal 1d4.
higher_level: When cast at higher levels you can reduce the incoming attack roll by that level cast. The healing increase by 1d4 for each level cast above 1.

teaser: Your bark is worse than your bite
spellText: During conversation can attempt to take the upper hand. A target that can understand you in conversation makes a Charisma saving throw. If they fail you cause them to take disadvantage on any Charisma saving throws and ability checks while you are within 120ft of them. If a creature under this effect your first attack against them deals 1d8 extra psychic damage. If they succeed then your next Charisma ability check has +1d8 to the roll.
higher_level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack or for the Charisma ability check increases by 1d8 for each slot above 1st.

spellText: You line up your target, with a single target cantrip. While this spell is active  your single target cantrips have a -5 to attack rolls and add +10 damage of the same type as the spell.

You raise creatures within a 10ft radius centred on a location that are prone. The targets are brought to their feet at no movement cost. If a target is unwilling they must make a wisdom saving throw, on a failure they stand, on a success, nothing happens.
higher_level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can increase the radius by 10ft per level above 2nd.

teaser: Cast out the fear in hearts
spellText: Creatures within a 15ft radius can't be frightened and deal 1d6 bonus damage on their next attack.
higher_level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can increase the damage by 1d6 per level above 2nd.

spellText: Target a weapon or object, it is forced 15ft away from you. If the weapon is being held or carried the creature holding must make a DEX saving throw. On a failure the weapon also is moved 15ft away from you.

Your next weapon attack against a creature deals 1d8 radiant damage. If that creature is morally opposed to your Oath it takes an additional 2d8 damage and is compelled to flee from you for 1 round on a failed WIS save.
Your next weapon attack against a creature that attacked a friendly creature within 30ft deals an additional 2d8 damage.
higher_level: When you cast this spell at higher level you deal an additional 1d8 damage per level.

teaser: On your knees and around your neck
spellText: Target creature makes a CON saving throw. On a failure it has a magic shock collar around its neck. As a bonus action or a reaction you can cause 2d8 lightning damage to the target as long as the target is within 200ft. When they take damage they roll a CON save and on a failure they lose their movement speed for 1 round. A target can make a CON save at the end of their round to break free.

teaser: Let's see what we're dealing with
spellText: You can see the heat being given off by creatures, as colourful silhouettes. Any natural heat created such as fire will also be seen. You can see this through as many walls or obstructions within the range.
higher_level: If cast at 3rd level or above the range increases to 120ft.

teaser: Spells might appear bigger than they seem.
spellText: You attempt to exaggerate a spell. When you successful damage a hostile target with a cantrip, you can cast the spell again.

At the cost of full movement, you can hold off your action for 1 round.  On the next round you can either: Deal 4d8 extra damage on a successful targeted attack, heal for 3d8 or dash as bonus action with 15ft extra movement speed.

teaser: Keep them where you can see them
spellText: On your next weapon attack deal an extra 2d8 radiant damage. When a creature is hit they are reduced to 0 movement speed for the next round.
higher_level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

teaser: Show them the full extent of your love
spellText: You surround a target with blissful imagery and voices. They must make a WIS saving throw. On a failure they are stunned until the start of your next action. Once the spell ends they take 3d10 psychic damage. On a success, the spell dissipates.
Target a creature to cast out. They must make a WIS save, on a failure a divine hand drags them up to 30ft in any direction you choose. On a success nothing happens
higher_level: When cast at 4th-level or above you may target additional creatures equal to the spell level.

spellText: Target a creature that has just succumb to a condition. Roll a WIS saving throw against creature's Spell save DC. On a success, the creature no longer has the condition, instead you have the condition. If this condition is from a spell, you act as if the spell was cast on you. On a failure, your spell does nothing.

For the duration of this spell you gain proficiency in a machine, man-made object or device of your choice. If the object is being held by a hostile target then you can cause it to malfunction or explode if it is capable of it. The explosion does 4d8 fire damage in a 10ft radius, all creatures within the radius must make a DEX Saving throw against the caster Spell Save DC.

A target within range makes a WIS saving throw. On a failure they share their fate with you. When they are healed you are healed for the same amount. When you take damage they take the same damage. At the start of every round, you must make a WIS saving throw against your own Spell Save DC in order to keep the spell in effect.

teaser: Put them out of their misery
spellText: Target a creature that is either feared or incapacitated and deal 4d12 psychic damage. If a creature is less than 10% total HP, on death saving throws or 5 levels of exhaustion then deal maximum damage.
While the spell is active, your ranged attacks you make lets you ricochet off a surface. You gain no disadvantage on attacks on creatures behind cover.

Make a touch attack against a target. You do 1d4 of poison damage and the target must make a CON save against your spell save DC. On a failure, they suffer the poisoned condition for 1d4 rounds.

If you have consumed a vial of poison of any kind after casting this spell, you do not suffer from the effects of the poison instead on a touch attack of your choosing with the spell duration, you impart the poison to an object or target. If the spell ends before you have imparted to poison to an object or target you suffer the effects.

You touch a mundane or magical item of no more than 10 pounds and 6 feet in length and leave a visible mark on it. For the next 24 hours you can summon that object to your hand as long as you are on the same plane as it. The object stays in your possession for 10 minutes. You can only leave a mark on one item, if you cast this on another item, the previous mark disappears. If another creature is holding or carrying the object, it does not transport to you. A creature can remove the mark you have left with by making a Intelligence ability check against your Spell Save DC.

When you cast this on yourself, you can blend into a crowd of people. A crowd is deemed to be at least 20 people. While in a crowd, you considered hidden. The crowd is unchanged in their disposition towards you.
higher_level: When cast at 4th level or above when you enter a crowd you are considered hidden to enemy targets so long as they are not part of the crowd also.

teaser: It's too late, I've seen everything
spellText: You can detect and see any creature made structures, tunnels or buildings within 120ft. You can see these structures with near clarity at the point of casting, but cannot see any persons. Any objects shown appear general (i.e. you know an object is a sword but not what kind of sword).
higher_level: When cast at 4th level or higher the range increases to 240ft.

teaser: Time to really learn a thing or two
material_components: A note book and writing tool
spellText:
You take the time to study a object, creature or location that you can see for the duration of study. Depending on the time spent studying you gain knowledge about the subject. This information is at DM discretion and is accurate to your understanding of the world. This study is considered light activity and can be done during long rest.

1 minutes time studying: You understand what the subject is

10 minute time studying: You understand the alchemical and scientific properties of the subject

1 hour time studying: You understand the most appropriate application/s of the subject (how it's used ), or it's derivatives

2 hours time studying: You have a greater understanding how the subject fits in with the world, how it behaving and what importance does it have.

A target creature makes a CON saving throw. On a failure they are stunned for 1d4 rounds. On a success they cannot be effected by this spell for 1 hour. At the start of the creature's round it make make a CON saving throw to break the spell.

teaser: When you really need to get something done
spellText: You hyper focus on a task or a conversation. For the next 10 minutes you gain advantage on history, insight, perception, persuasion, and deception. You gain +2 on Concentration saving throws on spells.

You summon a spectral ranged weapon that attempts to fire at a creature that you can see. While the spell is active, you make a ranged spell attack on the target. The spectral ranged weapon does 6d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier, the is considered piercing damage. The spectral ranged weapon positions itself to get around cover to attack the target.
higher_level: At Higher Levels the damage done increases by 1d6 every level over 3rd, you also push the target away from you 10ft.

spellText: You touch a corpse and cause it to return to the earth as nutrients, speeding up the decomposition. The ground where it lay becomes filled with plants and a small tree sapling. If the corpse isn't on dirt or a growable surface the body becomes dirt instead.

Target a location and at the start of each round a blast of magical energy strikes it. While this spell is active, at the start of your turn any creature within 10 feet of the location or if any creature that moves to a space within 10 feet of the location for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 2d10 Piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

teaser: Take their energy for us all
spellText: You create an aura that invigorates your allies. Until the start of your next round when they make an attack, all friendly creatures that are within the radius of the aura heal themselves equal to half the damage they deal. Once this heal has happen, the spell dissipates.
higher_level: If this spells is cast at 6th level or above the radius increases to 30 ft.

spellText: At target you can touch makes a WIS saving throw, on a failed save you state a keyword, phrase or information that they are forbidden to mention or relay to others for the duration of the spell. If they try to disobey this, they take 12d6 fire damage. On a save instead take 2d8 fire damage.
higher_level: When you cast this spell using a  spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 24 hours.

teaser: Bolster the resolve of your friends
spellText: You strengthen the resolve of your allies. An aura envelops all in a 30ft all resistance to psychic damage and advantage WIS (insight) saving throws against deception rolls.

When you are the target of a spell you can instead attempt to make it effect a different target instead. Make a WIS ability check against the casters spell save, if you are successful you can select a different target for the spell to effect. The new target must make any saving throw if needed by the spell, and the spells attack must be high enough to pass their AC if targeted.

You attempt the halt the damage of a single attack affecting your body and soul. For 1d4 rounds, the damage is withheld. At the end of the 1d4 rounds or at the end of your concentration you will take the damage.

You look upon the beauty and majesty of something or someone. Inspiring you with wonderment and joy. You gain advantage on ability checks and saving throws that you are proficient in for the spells duration and become immune to being frightened.
You launch an attack against an a location made of structural material such as stone, wood, crystal, or metal. It deals 5d8 siege damage to the location. Creatures take half damage.
higher_level: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher then add 2d8 of damage for each level

spellText:
Touch an object an leave an invisible mark upon it that you can detect the location of while concentrating on the spell.

When the object is within 120ft of you, you are able to detect it's location with greater clarity. When it is outside of this 120ft range you know of it's cardinal direction (including incline and decline) from you.

The mark can be discovered with a Intelligence Check against your spell save DC. The spell dissipates when the object is broken or dispelled.

Target either a friendly or hostile creature within range. They must make a WIS save, on a failure they receive either: 2d8 healing or 2d8 radiant damage. The spell then bounces to the nearest target within 10ft which also makes a WIS saving throw. It then bounces a third time within 10ft to the next nearest creature that hasn't been effected by this spell already. This can also target the caster, but never on the first target. If a creature successfully saves then the spell ends. A creature can choose to fail a save.
higher_level: You can add 1 additional target per spell level when cast on a 4th or higher spell slot.

spellText:
You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius sphere centred on a point of your choice within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, when ever they tell a lie they take 3d8 radiant damage. You know whether each creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw.

An affected creature is aware of the spell but cannot avoid answering questions. Such creatures can be evasive in its answers as long as it answers.

You set down a beacon that tries to disrupt the path of ranged attacks. While the spell is in effect, any ranged attack that is firing on a target within 15ft of the beacon, you make contested roll against the attack roll using your spell casting modifier.

If your save is higher than the attack roll, the range attack drifts 5ft towards to the beacon, missing the intended target. If the attack drifts, you must make a Concentration saving throw to continue the maintain the spell. At the end of each of your turns while the spell is active you must roll a Concentration saving throw to maintain the spell, due to the strain it puts on your body.

You reach out and touch a target, they must make a WIS saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target prone and deal 8d8 necrotic damage to creature, if they die you get healed for the half  the amount of damage your dealt.

teaser: We have ways of making you talk
spellText: On your next weapon attack, deal 4d8 psychic damage. You speak a question and forcibly extract the information the target has. The target must make a WIS saving saving throw, on a failure they give the information you seek. This information is considered true to the target. On a success, they do not give you any information.

You create a ward upon a building, protecting it from outside attacks and siege weaponry. The size of the building can be no larger than a two story wooden building. For the duration, the AC of the building increases by +5 and siege weapons do not do double damage. For every 25 damage done to the building, the strain of the spell forces you to make a Concentration saving throw to maintain the ward.
When a friendly target makes an attack or movement, you can convince another friendly target to make an attack or a movement as a free action.

teaser: Is that what we came here for?
spellText: You imbue an object with a intoxicating allure. Creatures that see it within 30ft make a WIS saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure they believe the object to be of great importance and will follow it for the spells duration. On each of their turns they must move towards the object to get within 5ft of the object. If they begin their turn within 5ft of the object, they can make a Investigation check against your spell save DC to discover the ruse. If moving towards the object would cause them harm, they can make a WIS saving throw to come to their senses.  On a success, they disbelieve the importance of said object.

teaser: Is that what we came here for?
spellText: When a friendly target fails a ability check, they take 3d6 psychic damage and for the next 10 minutes they get advantage on all ability checks that are in the same ability group (i.e. if you fail an insight check, you gain advantage on all WIS ability checks)

teaser: Is that what we came here for?
spellText: When a hostile creature damages an allied creature, you can use your reaction to make the hostile creature beg for forgiveness. As a reaction, the hostile creature makes a WIS saving Throw, on a failure they are prone on their knees until the start of your next round. The spell is broken if the hostile creature is attacked.

You summon 2 shrouded figured resembling factional allies. They each have 20 HP and can make either melee attacks with a weapon that you are proficient with or cast cantrips that use your spell attack. They have your movement speed. These figures move and attack on your turn.

You summon a vehicle to assist you in your adventure. The vehicle can suit 5 medium sized creatures, it can be either land or sea based, such as a carriage, wagon, chariot, cart, rowboat. If your setting allows this can include automobiles and motorcycles. You are considered proficient in this vehicle. You can only summon one vehicle at a time, when you summon a second vehicle, the previous vehicle disappears.

A stunned or incapacitated medium sized creature that you touch in encased in a elemental prism of your choosing. The prism does no damage to them and keeps them stabilised. Their weight is considered low enough for you to carry without hinderance. You can choose to end the spell early. When the target is out of the Binding they suffer from blindness for 1d4 + 2 minutes.

teaser: This is the next stage of our development
spellText:
You target a creature you can touch and force rapid evolution on them. The creature makes a CON saving throw. On a failure, the DM choses an feature of the targeted creature to evolve, this can be turning an arm into a tentacle, engorging the size of their skull, or growing an additional eye.

The effects of the evolution cause the target to gain the fear property and disadvantage ability checks and saving throws, on a success they suppress the evolution.

You target a dwelling and create a hidden room that only you can enter. The entrance is located in a corner of two walls, behind a door or under furniture. The hidden room is 15ft by 15ft and has a bed, cooking supplies, a desk and chair, and a water source. You can invite others into the room. If the spell ends with any objects or creatures inside then they are expelled violently into available space and take 2d8 bludgeoning damage.

teaser: I'll teach you a thing or two
spellText: Target a willing creature, you give them an informative lecture that share your knowledge with the target. At the end of casting, you choose one of the abilities you are proficient in, the target now uses your modifier for that ability for the spell duration.
higher_level: When cast at 6th level or above, you can target an additional creature to share your knowledge with for each level above 6.

spellText: Target a willing creature, you give them an informative lecture that share your knowledge with the target. At the end of casting, you choose one of the abilities you are proficient in, the target now uses your modifier for that ability for the spell duration.
higher_level: When cast at 6th level or above, you can target an additional creature to share your knowledge with for each level above 6.

teaser: I'll teach you a thing or two
spellText:
You touch a target that has recently died, you raise this target and turn it into a Scarecrow. The Scarecrow acts on your turn.

See the Scarecrow stat block:

stat_block.name: Raised Scarecrow
stat_block.skills:
Damage Vulnerabilities fire

Damage Resistances bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

Damage Immunities poison

Condition Immunities charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious
stat_block.languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.title: False Appearance.
traits.description: While the scarecrow remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate scarecrow.

actions.title: Multiattack.
actions.description: The scarecrow makes two claw attacks.

actions.title: Claw.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the scarecrow's next turn.

actions.title: Terrifying Glare.
actions.description: The scarecrow targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the scarecrow, the target must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be magically frightened until the end of the scarecrow's next turn. The frightened target is paralyzed.

teaser: I'll teach you a thing or two
spellText: On your next weapon attack, deal 7d8 necrotic damage. If the damage deals more renders the targets HP to less than 50 HP the creature is killed outright.

You select 2 willing creatures, until the start of your next round all damage taken by those creatures is dealt to you instead. If you are knocked unconscious by this damage, at the start your next round you Heal, if you are not knocked unconscious , you choose a single target and Harm.

Heal: You heal half the chosen creatures half the damage you have taken.

Harm: You harm a single creature within range of you, they take half the damage taken.
higher_level: When cast at levels at 6th level or above, add an additional willing creature per level.

spellText: You quickly stride forwards, travelling up to 6 miles in a chosen direction, but no less than 1 mile, crossing difficult terrain with ease. When you arrive at your destination you gain a level of exhaustion.

teaser: Let's give this thing some juice
spellText: Touch a magic item that has expended it's charges. You give it back a single charge. Once a magic item has been charged in this way then you must have a long rest before you can charge it again.
higher_level: When cast at levels at 6th level or above, add an additional charge per level.

teaser: Protect this village with all you have
material_components: A gem worth 400 gold that is consumed
spellText:
You create a magically shield around a large area of a 300ft radius. Damaging magical spells, siege attacks and other elemental damage can not pass through the shield. Creatures can pass in and out of the of the shield at will. It can extend above ground in a dome or in a sphere below ground as well at a cost of 150ft of radius.

If more than one caster casts this spell then the spells radius increases by an additional 300ft. So three spell casters would be able to create a 900ft radius magical dome shield.
higher_level: When cast at 6th-level the duration increases to 1 day, at 7th it increases to 7 days, at 8th it increases to 1 month, and 9th it increases to 1 year. The gem needed increases by 200 gold each level.

teaser: Protect this village with all you have
spellText: You summon the sounds of a symphony. The sounds of a epic symphony swell to all within the radius of the spell, based the on song you choose for them to play the following will happen:

twoTable_rows.right: An illusory flight of creatures of your choice charge at the creatures within the radius. All creatures in that cone must make a WIS saving throw, on a failure they take 12d8 force damage. On a success, they take half damage.
You give all creatures within the radius 10 Temp HP. When that Temp HP reaches 0, the creature is considered restrained for 1 round.
You create a dancefloor that is filled with couples dancing. This area is considered difficult terrain and all creatures within the area are considered heavily obscured.

Within the area you create as many motes of healing as there are creatures. Each mote has 1d8 of healing. Creatures must use a bonus action to touch the mote to gain it's healing properties. Each creature is limited to one mote per turn.

teaser: Can do this the easy way or the hard way
spellText: Target a wall, door, ceiling, window or floor of a structure, if the structure can be destroyed. If it can be destroyed the spell triggers an explosion on the target, all creatures within a 30ft cone behind the target must make a DEX saving throw. On a failure they take 12d6 force damage and a deafened for 1d4 -1 rounds. On a success they take half the damage.

teaser: Too much knowledge can be a dangerous thing
spellText: A target creature must make a CHA saving throw or a flow of overwhelming information floods into their mind. Dealing 10d8 psychic damage. If the creature survives this then they roll on the long term madness table. If they are reduced to 0hp by this spell then their head explodes. On a successful save they take half damage and are not effected by long term madness.

material_components: A flower grown in a graveyard
spellText: You touch a corpse that has been dead for no longer than 10 minutes. You extract from the corpse the mannerisms, cadence, personal information and recent memories of the person they once were. The DM may exclude information at their discretion. This information is enough to convincingly pass yourself off as the person, should you assume their visage. You retain this information for 1d4 + 1 hours.

All creatures in a 30ft cone make a WIS save. On a success they take 4d8 psychic damage. On a failure their beliefs in their cause, self worth, relationship, community, or nation are shattered along with the psychic damage. They roll 1d6 on the table below to see what their reaction is.

This effect lasts for 7 days with a roll each morning to break the spell. If the target fails each day for the total length then they full turn from their old belief.

twoTable_rows.right: Outcome
Fear: The target has a fear of what they once held dear and attempts to flee from it.
Anger: The target grows angry and resentful towards it, possibly doing something rash.
Hate: The target puts all of their motivation behind dismantling their old belief.
Revenge: The target attempts to destroy or kill the perpetrator of the belief.
Dismissal: The target simply walks away, never to put any thought or consideration into the belief again.
Loathing: The target takes a path of self destruction, choosing actions that will lead to their own ruin.

teaser: Look at things from a different perspective
spellText: A creature that you touch makes a WIS saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, for the duration of the spell you can look through the targeted creature's eyes and see what they see. This only allows you to see what they see and does not include what they hear. You can make actions of your own body while this occurs. On a success, the target knows you tried to see eye to eye with them.

You point to a target location and summon a strike of powerful explosive to hit that location from the sky. On your next round of action any creature within a 120ft circle must make a DEX saving throw or take 8d12 force damage.

Select a 20ft cube at a location to see what happened there over the last day. Figures and changes appear as ghostly images. You can quickly speed up, pause and rewind time over the 24 hours recorded. Sound is not recorded and if there was magic cast you see what type it was. If the area was subject to a dispel magic or anti-magic field then those objects or location are shrouded. Creatures that cannot be scried upon or are immune to magic as also not recorded.

Select an empty space to summon a small crate of supplies, for 3 people. This includes rations for 3 days, a bedroll, blanket, water for 3 days, a toolkit of your choice, a pack of your choice, flint and 3 simple weapons of your choice.
higher_level: When cast at a higher level you add one extra person's supply per spell slot. You may also summon marital weapons.

spellText: You summon 4 Knights to assist you in battle. They act on your command on your turn.

stat_block.name: Knight
stat_block.languages: Understands the languages of its summoner but only speaks Common

traits.title: Brave.
traits.description: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

actions.title: Multiattack.
actions.description: The knight makes two melee attacks.

actions.title: Greatsword.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.title: Heavy Crossbow.
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

actions.title: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
actions.description: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is incapacitated.

actions.title: [Reaction] Parry.
actions.description: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellText: When an enemy casts a spell, you can either, halve the damage or halve the targets. For a single target spell, you must halve the damage, for a non-damage spell you must halve the targets.

You target a hostile creature that is casting a spell that requires a command, order or directive (i.e. suggestion, command, Summon Greater Demon) you can alter the words slightly to benefit your own agenda.

teaser: I get to pick and choose
spellText: When an enemy rolls damage dice, you can choose to reroll a number of dice equal to half the number of dice originally rolled, rounding up. The enemy target must make a WIS saving throw, on a failure they also take the rerolled dice damage. On a success, they take half of the rerolled damage.

teaser: I get to pick and choose
material_components: A holy symbol of your deity and an artwork worth 500g
spellText: Touch a target who has been dead for no more than 1 year or on death saving throws. You must make a CHA saving throw against your spell save DC. On a success you allow your deity to release their soul to their care. Celestial beings appropriate to your deity appear and carry them to the afterlife. Once cast the target is resurrected after 7 days and if they return they are changed by your deity in some physical way to reflect the boon they granted. The deity may bind the target's soul into their service, the subject of this service is at DM's discretion. A soul can make a d20 saving throw adding proficiency to resist this resurrection.

teaser: I get to pick and choose
spellText: You cast this spell in a 30ft cone in front of you, all creatures within the cone must make a WIS saving throw. On a failure they erupt in holy flames, taking 4d6 damage. the damage type can be either necrotic or radiant damage. At the start of each of their creatures turns they take an additional 4d6 damage. They can use their turn to put out the holy flames, making another WIS saving throw. On a success, they douse the flames before further damage comes to them.

In a 15ft radius centred on yourself you awaken all small plants and fungi. These plants can be no taller than 7ft and can't be a tree, bush or other plant that is bigger than a tiny size in width. These awakened plants can speak one language know by its creator. They uproot themselves and have a movement speed of 15ft. When in combat they act as a swarm.

The awakened plants are charmed by you for 30 days or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. When the charmed condition ends, the awakened creature chooses whether to remain friendly to you, based on how you treated it while it was charmed

stat_block.name: Awakened Plant Swarm
stat_block.skills:
Damage Vulnerabilities fire

Damage Resistances piercing

Damage Immunities poison

Condition Immunities charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious
stat_block.languages: One language known by its creator

traits.title: False Appearance.
traits.description: While the plants remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal group of plants.

traits.title: Swarm.
traits.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. A creature within the swarm is considered to be within difficult terrain.

actions.title: Rake.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 57 (23d4) piercing damage, or 27 (11d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

actions.title: Entangle.
actions.description: The swarm attempts to hold a creature in its space in place. Make a grapple at advantage with a +10 bonus to STR.

spellText:
You target a a willing creature that you will share with. While the spell in active, any damage they take, the damage is evenly split between the both of you.

If they have levels of exhaustion 2 or over, the levels are dispersed as evenly as they can be to both of you. If the split is uneven, the target can choose who takes the extra level.

If they sustain a timed condition, the two of you both have the condition for half the original time. Any saving throws required to break the condition can be rolled by either character.

The spell only shares the first of the above instances, which ever happens first. If the target already has a condition or exhaustion the split immediately occurs. After the split happens, the spell ends.

Tentacles or flesh erupt from your body and drag every creature within 40ft towards you. Creatures can make a DEX saving throw to avoid being dragged. Once dragged the tentacles retract back into your body. Creatures that are dragged in take 10d8 bludgeoning damage.

teaser: Nice magic item, be a shame if anything happened to you
spellText: You target a magic item being held or carried by a creature, they must make a INT saving throw, on a failure the creature with the item takes 5d8 + 1d8 per charge over 1 stored within the item targeted.

teaser: You thought you could watch me without notice?
spellText: While this spell is active, whenever a detection or message type spell is cast within 30ft of you, you can either cast the spell back at the caster of the detection spell (i.e. if you are being scried on, you can scry back on the caster) or cause a synaptic discharge at the caster dealing 6d8 psychic damage on a failed INT saving throw.

teaser: Man needs to fear nature's retribution
spellText: You target a location and cause nature to reclaim it. In a 150ft radius plants erupt from the earth and completely consume a building and tear it apart. Trees regrow, grass burst from the pavement, and flowers bloom. Any structure in the radius takes 10d10 siege damage. Creatures caught in the spell take 6d10 piercing damage as the plants push them out the area.

You take a inanimate object and break it down to it's raw materials used to create it. The size of the object can be no larger than a 10ft cube. The quality of the materials is commensurate with the quality of the object.

You touch an inanimate object and transform it's appearance. This new form can be better or worse than it currently is. For example you can turn an average wooden chair into a beautifully decorated ornate one or vice versa. The size of the object can be no larger than a 10ft cube.
higher_level: If this spell is cast at 8th level then the size of the object can be up to 400ft, such as a building.

material_components: A hard copy of the information
spellText: You rain down information across an area up to 1 mile square. The information is shown as a brief pamphlet. The information that rains down across the area can be a replication of something you are holding or information that you have. When a person reads the pamphlet they make a Wisdom Save against your spell DC. On a failure they believe what is on it is the truth. A pamphlet disappears when the spell ends and is not being held or within eyeline of a person.

material_components: A lock of the target's hair
spellText: You attempt to control a target's body. A target you can see within range must make a CHA saving throw or be puppetted by you. You gain complete control of their body including attacking, speak what you wish and even cast spells if can they cast them. This spell can be cast on stunned, incapacitated or dead creatures. The creature is are aware of what they are doing.

material_components: An iron figure of a soldier
spellText: You attempt to arm a populace with magical weapons. Roll a d100, based on the roll, as many weapons are conjured in a 10ft cube in front of you. They are considered either longswords, short bows or spears and their damage counts are magical damage.

You force those you deem as non-believers to see the error in their ways. You raise your arms and at a point in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range is created. Each creature in the radius must make a WIS saving throw. On a failure they take 10d8 of radiant or necrotic damage and are to be under the poisoned condition for 1d4 rounds.

You attempt to breath new life into the soil around you up to a 2 mile radius . You perform a ritual that removes blight, poison or hazardous effects to the terrain. This does not work if the area is affected by a curse.

The soil is enriched with your tender care, and plant life grows at double it's rate until reaching it's natural zenith for the next year. Food yielded from this area is twice the size it would normally be during that time.

teaser: You don't deserve the coin you hold
spellText: You target a creature you see within range. They must make a WIS saving throw. On a failure, roll 1d100, that becomes the percentage of coins on their person that turn to rusted worthless metal.

teaser: You don't deserve the coin you hold
spellText:
The structure of your being becomes like ooze. You maintain the size you are currently are. You gain immunity to piercing, slashing and bludgeoning damage, but vulnerability to acid and fire damage.

While in this form, as a bonus action, you can try to engulf a creature of your size or smaller into your new form for 1 round. If you choose to grapple them and they fail then they are engulfed in your form, you can choose to deal 3d6 acid damage to them whilst grappled. The damage dealt this way you heal for.

material_components: A gemstone with 10g and at least 2foot cube of required materials
spellText: You form a drone to do your bidding out of materials. These materials can be a combination of  wood, meat, metal, or stone. This drone follows simple commands and can perform tasks with the same proficiency as the caster at time of creation. These drones have 10 HP and 30ft movement speed.

You create a 20ft sphere around you and any projectile that hits the edge of the sphere is stopped. When the spell ends the projectiles are fired back out in a ring dealing 6d12 piercing damage to those within a 40ft sphere of you, but not within a 20ft sphere of you.

teaser: Throw down your weapons, all of you
spellText: You attempt to disarm those in your area. At a point in a 30-foot-radius sphere centred on a point within range of your choose, all creatures must make a STR saving throw. On a failure, all items, weapons and objects that are being held by the creature are knocked 40ft out of their grasp, unless it can not be disarmed from the creature. On a success the creature maintains their grip.

teaser: Let us show them the meaning of haste
spellText:
You and up to 7 other willing creature of your choosing become master of traversal. Each of you gain the following:
  • Can Dash as a bonus action.
  • Your climbing and swimming speed becomes equal to your walking speed
  • Your jump distance is tripled
If the spells end from your concentration breaking, each target takes 2d6 force damage from the sudden loss of speed.

You summon spectral chess pieces around you standing at 6ft tall. These pieces behave like chess pieces and you can move one piece on your turn. The pieces summoned at 1 rook which can move forward or two the side at 40ft of movement. 1 knight which can move 15ft in one direction then 5ft to the side. 1 bishop which can move 40ft in a diagonal line. 1 king which can move 5ft in any direction. 5 pawns that can move 10ft on their first move and 5ft on following moves. You become the queen and gain 10ft of bonus movement.

Should you or a chess piece move into the same space as a hostile target they take 6d8 magical damage. Each piece has 10hp. If more than one piece would take damage from a spell or attack then only one piece takes the damage.

If a rook moves 40ft in one direction then you are healed for 6d8 and the piece is destroyed. These chess pieces cannot benefit from spells.

teaser: Search your feelings, for they are true
spellText: All targets in a 120ft circle must make a CHA saving throw. On a failure you have command of their emotions. You can amplify an emotion of your choice to heightened levels or choose to lessen said emotion. Targets are unaware that they are being effected and feel an overwhelming flood of the emotion. Each round a target can make a CHA save to break free. If a target fails twice times in a row they are unable to break free until the spell ends. Once the spell ends that targets are aware that they were in a heighted emotional state.

teaser: Be wary of your own shadow
spellText:
You stir paranoia into a group of creatures to make them believe their own shadows are against them. Choose a 20ft radius point centred within range. Each creature in that area must make a WIS saving throw. On a failure their shadows rise against the creature and deal 6d8 psychic damage per turn. At the end of each creature's turn they make another WIS saving throw to disbelieve these shaded attacks.

These shadows are only dissipated by magical darkness or when the spell ends. On a success, the spell fails against the creature.

teaser: You may not love the gods, but you should fear them
material_components: A bottle of holy oil, a drop of your blood, a freshly picked flower
spellText: In a 10 mile radius you can perform a awesome act of your deity. Roll 1d8 from the table below or pick one. This lasts for 1 day or until cancelled. Once the spell ends all the changes revert back to how they were.

threeTable_rows.center: Dark star: You cause an eclipse as either a blood moon or total solar eclipse.
threeTable_rows.right: Light break: You cause the darkness from an atmospheric or astronomical source to cease, such as breaking the clouds or ending an eclipse.

threeTable_rows.center: Blood river: Water transmutes into blood in all sources within the area. It reverts to back water afterwards
threeTable_rows.right: Fountain of purity: A spring of clean and chilled water erupts from the ground as a geyser.

threeTable_rows.center: Cursed existence: Creatures become sick and begin to vomit up blood as well as have it seep from eyes and ears. This causes no physical damage to the creatures.
threeTable_rows.right: Hallowed presence: Creatures walk lighter and with a glow that emits light 5ft around them.

threeTable_rows.center: Rotten to the core: All processed or stored food rots and become putrid
threeTable_rows.right: Feast of the gods: All food becomes delicious and fresh.

threeTable_rows.center: Toll of the dead: All of the dead rise as harmless zombies and wander the land, upon the spell ending they wander back to their resting site and return to how they were raised. They are unaware of the living and do not interact with them.
threeTable_rows.right: Ghostly goodbyes: All the souls of the dead rise as ghosts that can be spoke with and interacted with. They can not harm the living in any way.

threeTable_rows.center: Storm of anger: A great storm bellows of the land with hail, lightning and devastating winds.
threeTable_rows.right: Song of blessing: A great harmonic celestial tune, breeze filled with flowers and fireflies surrounds the area, and ambient temperature becomes pleasant for the creatures majority desire.

threeTable_rows.center: Madness: All creatures roll on the Short-term madness table.
threeTable_rows.right: Praise: All creatures must state one thing they admire about the other person when in conversation with them. All creatures gain an overwhelming sense of love towards each other.

threeTable_rows.center: Babble: All creatures start speaking in a language they don't understand. Those that can understand the language hear gibberish
threeTable_rows.right: Connection: All creatures suddenly understand each other as if they are speaking the same language.

teaser: See the world how it truly is.
spellText: You remove the blindfolds from the eyes of the people. Target a 60ft circle and any creature within must make a WIS saving throw. On a failure they gain darkvision, truesight, they know if they are charmed or under effects of possession and have advantage on saving throws against being charmed for the next 10 minutes.

material_components: A lock of the targets hair or golden thread worth 500g
spellText:
Select a creature you wish to make an effigy of. They must be make a WIS saving throw. On a failure, an effigy of them is created at a point of your choosing within range. The effigy has the same HP of the targeted creature at the point of casting, has 20AC and has no damage resistances, immunities or vulnerabilities. When the spell ends, all damage that the effigy has sustained is dealt to the targeted creature. The damage dealt to the creature is considered necrotic. If the creature sustains enough damage to kill the creature instead has 0 HP.

The targeted creature is aware of the location of the effigy and the caster of the spell.

On a success the spell fails to find purchase.

You awaken a building no larger than 5,000 square feet (i.e. a longhouse, large barn, community centre, chapel). The building gains an intelligence of 10, it gains the ability to speak to you telepathically. It gains the ability to move, creating the necessary appendages and has similar senses to a human. The GM chooses stats appropriate to (like the below Hulking Building for example). The buildings a walking speed of 40ft.

The Building can house as many creatures as it would normally hold while it was inanimate.

stat_block.name: Hulking Building
stat_block.skills:
Saving Throws Con +9, Wis +0, Cha +0

Damage Immunities poison, psychic

Condition Immunities blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, prone

traits.title: Arcane Fragility.
traits.description: If an area of the building is within an anitmagic field that portion of the building becomes inanimate

traits.title: Constructed Nature.
traits.description:
An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

traits.title: Siege Monster.
traits.description: The building deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.title: Multiattack.
actions.description: The building makes three slam attacks. It can replace two of these attacks with a bound attack.

actions.title: Slam.
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.title: Bound.
actions.description: The build leaps into the going 40ft horizontal and 10ft high. Jumping Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

teaser: Become the next stage of your own growth
spellText: You target a creature and cause them to rapidly mutate. Their body shifts and changes into something new. They must make a CON saving throw or be changed. You can give them one of the following mutations in the table below, once a target is affected by this spell they can not be affected by it again until that mutation is reverted.. A greater restoration can revert this changed if cast within 7 days. Otherwise this becomes their permanent form for the sake of restorative spells. A wish spell can revert the target back to their original state. You can target yourself.

twoTable_rows.right: Mutation

Multi-limbs:

The target grows up to 2 extra limbs of your choice. The target can use a bonus action to make a weapon attack, use a magic item or cast a cantrip.

Monster Arms:

The target's arms become monstrous. You can pick their form. They either gain +2 STR or +2 DEX

Tail:

The target grows a tail of a form you decide or fuse their legs into a tail. They become immune to being knocked prone.

Alteration:

The targets body is alter to be a new version of themselves. Their shape, sex, voice and anything else you wish is altered.

Monster:

You cause their body to mutate into a hideous monstrous form. Work with your DM to determine this form

Skin:

The target's skin changes into either fur, scales, plates or an exo-skeleton

Evolution:

Their body evolves to the next form for their race. Work with your DM to determine this form

Animal Head:

Their head becomes that of a animal of your choice at an appropriate size for their body.

Chimera:

You cause additional animal limbs or features to sprout from their body.

Devolve:

Their body devolves into something more primitive. Work with your DM to determine this form

spellText: You rise 60 ft into the air and fire a devastating beam of kinetic energy. At a point you can see from you erupting a continuous beam that can follow a curved line of your choosing up to 100ft long. If the beam passes along a creature, they must make a DEX saving throw, if they fail, they take 8d8 force damage, or half the damage on a success. If the line passes a creature multiple times, they take an additional 6d8 (half if they succeeded), this damage can only be applied to a creature once, no matter how many times you can pass them.

material_components: A drop of the targets blood or a gem worth 800g
spellText: You summon a shadowy form to seek out a target. You speak their name to the shadow and it will begin to move towards them. You are unable to follow the killer as it hunts and will seek them out as long as they are on the same plane of existence. When the form finds the target it attempts to hide and assassinate the target for 20d12 with a +8 to hit. If the target dies then it possess their body and you will be aware that they are successful. The possessed body will maintain a simple routine for 1d6 days before leaving the body. If they do not kill the target the shadow disappears. The shadow has 14AC and 30HP.

material_components: A golden key worth at least 1,000g
spellText:
You attempt to enter a creature's demiplane, against their will. The creature who's demiplane you try to enter, must be on the same plane as you are currently, or are in their demiplane at the time of casting. You roll a d20, trying to beat a 15. Your knowledge and connection to the demiplane modifies the roll.

If you succeed in your roll you can enter and exit the demiplane without detection (outside of someone seeing you in the demiplane) and can spend a total of 5 minutes in the demiplane before ejected out. For every character outside of yourself that you bring with you into the demiplane, the duration allowed inside, decreases by 1 minute.

On a failure, the creature knows someone has tried to break into their demiplane but not by who.

twoTable_rows.right: Save Modifier

twoTable_rows.left: Secondhand (you have heard of the target's demiplane)
Firsthand (you have entered the demiplane once)
Familiar (you have regularly entered the demiplane)

twoTable_rows.right: Save Modifier

twoTable_rows.left: You have something that was once in the demiplane
Something that you own is currently in the demiplane

material_components: A cloud in the sky within 5 miles of you
spellText: You and up to 8 others safely float rapidly up to the clouds and can walk, climb and bounce along them as if they were slightly solid. You are each surrounded in temperate and breathable air. If the cloud is part of a storm of any size then you aren't effected by lightning or winds. When the spell ends you float down on a puff of cloud to the ground.

teaser: Anything you can do, you can now do
spellText: You focus inward and split yourself into two beings. You pick an ability, tool or weapon you are proficient in and make a copy of you that has additional expertise in just that one thing but have the same ability scores, health, Ac, but not items. Appearing as a clothed version of you only.  They are friendly to you and share your personality and act on a separate initiative. While separated from you, you lose any bonuses to that ability, tool or weapon. The copy can learn and memories events and when the spell ends you both become one again. You gain the knowledge they learnt and share their memories. You both know which one is the copy and understand the nature of their existence.

teaser: Let your death be worth more than this
material_components: A cloth from a holy place worth 10,000g to a recognised religion
spellText:
You bring the spirits of those fallen around you in a 200ft radius back as glowing angelic or undead representations of themselves. For 1 hour, an friendly creature that has died within the last day fight along side you and your allies. They are unable to be killed and deal 4d8 radiant or necrotic damage on attacks. While in this form their bodies can not be harmed. At the end of the spell they are considered to have only just died.

If they kill the creature that killed them or completed their objective then the spell material cost to bring them back is quartered rounding down.

You can instead choose to bring all the fallen back at 0hp but stable if they have a body that can sustain life at the cost of 5 levels of exhaustion to yourself and this spell can not be cast again for 1 year.

teaser: What is reality, what is the dream?
spellText: You target a conjured illusion of no more than 20ft in size and attempt to manifest it into reality. You make a DC 20 WIS saving throw. On a success the illusion becomes real. If the illusion was of a creature it gains sentience as a new being. If the Illusion was of the caster than the manifestation gains their memory, but knows it has become real from a spell.

material_components: A diamond worth at least 6,000g, consumed
spellText: You create an illusion of an object, location, weather event, super natural phenomena, natural event, group of creatures, or landscape up to 2 miles across. This illusion can be interacted with and feels real to those who are within its space. You can have the illusion follow commands and it can adapt to outside input. The illusion can damage creatures, but when they die they are instead hidden and placed into stasis until the illusion ends at which point they waken at the same health they entered the illusion at. While in stasis they do not age and can not be harmed by non-magical means. If you cast this spell every 7days for 1 year then the illusion manifests itself into becoming real on a successful DC25 CHA saving throw. If the manifestation becomes real, any deity or higher power that has sway over that location is alerted. You can choose for creatures in stasis to either die or return to life at full health in the manifestation where they last were.

teaser: We saved the cosmos and our reward is minimum wage?
material_components: Golden Statue of a Bearded Man worth 2,000g
spellText:
You summon several astral food vendors to feed the masses. The spell cost increases for each vendor you choose to summon at a time by 100g. These vendors appear in a circle around you and come with tables, firepits, shade and drinking fountains. Eating at these vendors costs a small amount of coin and a specific item, act or memory for their services. The caster pays the coin cost, but the consumer of the vendor's food must pay the specific cost to them, each cost must be new/different to previous time. Each vendor can feed up to 100 people for 1 day. Casting this spell is considered light activity. The effects of eating at the vendor starts after your next long rest then until the next time you long rest. You can have up to three meals at once.

Darian's Daring Dessert

Cost: Something from a foe you slew.

Darian provides a wide range of interesting experimental desserts to try. These give you +10 to initiative rolls and you can't be surprised.

Jor'raan's Justice Juices

Cost: Object from a fallen or lost ally

Jor'raan is a merchant of protection, his juices aid you in protecting those around you. A cup gives you a ward of 3d8 to protect an ally from as much damage as a reaction. Once the ward has absorb the total damage it dissipates.

Belvaine's Bountiful BelvaTea

Cost: A story of adventure

Belvaine's BelvaTea is famous for its franchised secret formula. A cup gives you +15 movement speed.

Caledius' Cheerful Charcoal

Cost: A winning arm wrestle against Caledius

Caledius creates a wonderful charcoal box of meats. A box gives you 2d8 temp hit points and when you have any temp hit points you gain 1d6 to attack rolls.

Skalen's Soulful Soup

Cost: A memory from your youth

Skalen has an ever cooking pot of stew full of flavour. A bowl gives you 3d12 satisfaction dice. As a bonus action you can roll one to regain that much health plus your proficiency bonus.

Sommersby's Satisfying Salads

Cost: A gift from a friend

Sommersby has scoured the planes for the freshest ingredients for her salads. A plate gives you a lucky dice.

Broben's Brooding Brewery

Cost: A bottle of ale you got as a present

Broben has mastered the art of brewing and has a new drink on tap every 7 days. A mug gives you advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

Percel's Perfect Pastries

Cost: A regretful story

Percel has an eye for the finest pastries and has even won an award or two. A piece gives you truesight.

Koat's Kalming Krustaceans

Cost: A note from your child or parent

Koat has been a notorious fisherman for many years and has managed to get catch that no one else can. A plate gives you the spell colour spray as a an action that doesn't cost a spell slot.

material_components: A jade stone with 1,000gp that is consumed
spellText: You become the very monster that they believe you to be. Your size becomes gargantuan. You Health increases by 3d100 + 50. Either your Strength or Dexterity plus your Constitution increase by 8 to a maximum of 32. You have a frightful presence and all within 1 mile must make a DC 16 WIS saving throw or be feared. Your movement speed doubles and AC increases by +5. Once this spell ends then you revert back to your normal size at the same health you cast the spell at.

teaser: For a price, you'll erase anyone
spellText: You summon a golden ranged weapon of your choosing into your grasp. It's maximum range is 240ft. You can make 2 ranged attacks with the ranged weapon. Use your spell attack to hit. On a successful hit, the target takes 4d12 force damage. This attack scores a critical hit if the number on the d20 is 18 or higher. On a critical hit, the attack deals an extra 8d12 force damage (for a total of 12d12 force damage). On a critical hit, the target must make a CON saving throw, on a failure, roll on the Lingering Injuries Table and the target sustains a lingering injury. On a success, they do not sustain any lingering injury.

twoTable_rows.right: Injury

Lose an Eye.You have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on ranged attack rolls. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the lost eye. If you have no eyes left after sustaining this injury, you're blinded.
Lose an Arm or a Hand.You can no longer hold anything with two hands, and you can hold only a single object at a time. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the lost appendage.

Lose a Foot or Leg.Your speed on foot is halved, and you must use a cane or crutch to move unless you have a peg leg or other prosthesis. You fall prone after using the Dash action. You have disadvantage on Dexterity checks made to balance. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the lost appendage.
Limp.Your speed on foot is reduced by 5 feet. You must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after using the Dash action. If you fail the save, you fall prone. Magical healing removes the limp.

Internal Injury.Whenever you attempt an action in combat, you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you lose your action and can't use reactions until the start of your next turn. The injury heals if you receive magical healing or if you spend ten days doing nothing but resting.
Broken Ribs.This has the same effect as Internal Injury above, except that the save DC is 10.
Horrible Scar.This has the same effect as Internal Injury above, except that the save DC is 10.

Festering Wound.Your hit point maximum is reduced by 10 every 24 hours the wound persists. If your hit point maximum drops to 0, you die. The wound heals if you receive magical healing. Alternatively, someone can tend to the wound and make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check once every 24 hours. After ten successes, the wound heals.

Festering Wound.Your hit point maximum is reduced by 10 every 24 hours the wound persists. If your hit point maximum drops to 0, you die. The wound heals if you receive magical healing. Alternatively, someone can tend to the wound and make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check once every 24 hours. After ten successes, the wound heals.
Minor Scar. The scar doesn't have any adverse effect. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal and regenerate, removes the scar.

spellText: You reach the very height of understanding and ascend to a higher form of knowledge. You gain expertise in all abilities, know all languages, and are immune to being feared. Any abilities that you already have expertise in are unaffected.

teaser: How much have you ever lost on a coin toss?
spellText: You target a creature, they make a WIS saving throw, on a failure you flip a coin, heads you die, tails the creature dies. On a success, you instead take 12d6 force damage. The result of the coin flip cannot be altered or changed in any way, even by wish or divine intervention.
